intro: Leucanthemum zawadzkii, commonly known as the Polish daisy, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its white to pale yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of yellow tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. It is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed areas, and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Leucanthemum zawadzkii is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
